metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1554 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in MozillaFirefox before 32.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service(memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrarycode via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1554` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 32.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 32.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 32.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 32.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '32.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
